thread.title: Extra Points: Friday's prep highlights

author: Gazette Staff
title: Extra Points: Friday's prep highlights
text:
Buy Now HANNAH POTES/Gazette Staff 
Great Falls' Max Weissman takes down West runner Kylan Ontiveros Friday. West won 41-30 for its sixth straight victory. Friday's highlights 
FOOTBALL 
• Six different players scored touchdowns in as Billing West won its sixth game in a row, 41-30 over Great Falls. Remington Hjelvik had the longest scoring play, a 67-yard run and Braydon Deming recovered a fumble and returned it 26 yards for a score. 
• Nate Dick had a hand in six touchdowns and Billings Senior ran past Billings Skyview 47-13. Senior improved to 8-1 and Skyview fell to 1-8. Senior led 26-13 at the break and its defense made Skyview to punt twice in the second half, forced a fumble and intercepted a pass. 
• Dallas Mack passed for four touchdowns in lifting Huntley Project over visiting Shepherd 56-14. The Red Devils (8-1) clinched the No. 2 seed out of District 3B and will travel to Jefferson next weekend for the opening round of the state playoffs. Mack’s TDs passes covered 44, 29, 18 and 3 yards. Teammate Lane Sumner also had a 95-yard scoring run. 
• Quaid Russell rushed for 423 yards and seven touchdowns in Custer-Hysham’s 75-61 win over Bridger. Ozzy Munoz added 275 rushing yards and three touchdowns. The Rebels (8-1) clinched the 6-Man South conference championship. 
VOLLEYBALL 
• Molly Little and Ashley Pomroy had eight kills each as fifth-ranked Billings Skyview swept Butte 25-16, 25-16, 25-16 in an Eastern AA match. Makayla Herman and Ashley Jones contributed three aces each for the Falcons (6-3, 13-12), who had nine overall. Herman also led Skyview with 15 digs, and Kailey Thompson had 13. 
• Brianna Bromgard returned to the Billings Senior lineup and helped the Broncs to a 25-15, 25-15, 25-17 sweep of Great Falls in Eastern AA play.The Broncs (22-2, 8-0) play at Great Falls on Saturday. Bromgard had missed 10 matches with a knee injury. “It was fun to see,” Senior coach Jeff Carroll of Bromgard’s return. “Our offense had a little bit more pop tonight. It was a good win.” Aubrie Steiner and Shyanne Gilchrist each had 10 kills for the Broncs. Bromgard finished with 22 assists and three aces. 
• Billings Central swept Glendive to remain unbeaten in Eastern A despite having just one more kill than the Red Devils. The Rams had 24 kills, led by Alix Elliott’s nine, and Glendive had 23, seven from Marenah Crockett . “Another game where we struggled offensively, but between our back row players playing well and Alix finding her rhythm in the middle, we were able to make enough plays to win,” Rams coach Kylie Reitz said. “We’re hoping to come out tomorrow (against Sidney) and play better as we have a chance to lock up the number-one seed for divisionals.” 
• Reed Point-Rapelje won a battle of aces in a 22-25, 25-18, 25-17, 25-7 victory over Roberts. The teams combined for 29 aces. Brooke Krieger and Destiney Ayers had four each for RP-R, which had 16 overall. Brittany Prinkki had six of Roberts’ 13 aces. 
• Laurel got into the Eastern A win column for the first time by beating Sidney 25-14, 18-25, 25-12, 25-20. Abbie Lohof and Ellie Pfeifer had seven kills, and Sarah Wiscomb had 10 digs to help the Locomotives improve to 1-6 in league. Madison Thiesen had nine kills for Sidney, which outhit Laurel 27-24. The Eagles are also 1-7 in Eastern A. 
SOCCER 
• Bailly Woodring scored two goals -- one on a penalty kick -- to help the Billings Senior girls beat Great Falls 2-0 in a Class AA playoff match. The Broncs, who got four saves from Zoe Wolf , advance to the state tournament after missing out last season. Senior (8-3-2) will play Missoula Sentinel (8-2-2) in the first round of the tournament, which starts Thursday in Billings. 
• Ryne Icenoggle scored early and DC Chelgren added on in the second half as the Billings Skyview boys reached the Class AA state tournament for the first time since 2008. The trip comes via a 2-0 playoff win over Butte. Freshman goalkeeper Zach Hemmler recorded four saves to help keep the shutout. Skyview (8-4-1) takes on Helena (8-3-1) on Thursday in the first round of the state tournament in Billings.
